newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai to build pedestrian underpass below river.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai to build pedestrian underpass below river.

text.p: Shanghai will spend 435 million yuan ($52.4 million) to build a moving pedestrian walkway below the Huangpu river, the first of its kind in China, the Liberation Daily said on Friday.
Construction will begin in October and is due to be completed at the end of 1998, it said.
Travel time to cover the 506 metres will take 14 minutes and the tunnel will be equipped with state-of-the-art lighting, telecommunications and computer control, it said.

The walkway will link the western side of the city, currently the commercial and residential centre of Shanghai, to the Pudong New Area on the east, which the city government wants to turn into the Manhattan of Asia.
Many Shanghai people do not want to live or work in Pudong because of its poor transport links with the rest of the city.
